get.description: - **code**: The authorize token, normally the user with a customer profile does not have access to this data. If this is the case, you can obtain new tokens in the Tokens - "Developer Portal > Profile".

400.description: Erro generating, updating or validate token, check the information.

post.description: - **Body**: You need to enter the update token. If you do not have this data, "log in" again on the portal and request a new set of tokens (authorization_token and refresh_token).

400.description: Erro generating, updating or validate token, check the information.

post.description:
- **Authorization**: You can check if the "authorization_token" is valid.
  Send the authorization_token in the header using the "Authorization" key.

parameters.description: The authorization token is used to validate your identity in AD B2C, only accounts registered in our AD B2C can have API access.

schema.title: Authorization
schema.description: The authorization token is used to validate your identity in AD B2C, only accounts registered in our AD B2C can have API access.

parameters.name: Authorization

401.description: Unauthorized. Access token is missing or invalid.

parameters.description: The identifier of a profile associated with the advertiser account. If not you have this data, use GET method on "accounts" resource to list profiles associated with the access token passed in the HTTP Authorization header.

schema.title: Profileid
schema.description: The identifier of a profile associated with the advertiser account. If not you have this data, use GET method on "accounts" resource to list profiles associated with the access token passed in the HTTP Authorization header.
